title: Taiwan Outreach
description: Although the number of people in Taiwan following blockchain news is growing, they usually represent investors, not proposers.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is great and it is at the right place. In case the proposer could think about how the same project could be split into smaller steps, maybe even dividing the whole campaign into less time frames the founding would be easier due to less about and the community could benefit earlier as well, since it might draw less numbers but they'll be able to propose earlier than the given timeline ending. And build upon that success further.
f6_assessments.q1: According to the proposal the project will be implemented by an experienced team. Based on the detailed information given I think they are able to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: The project is auditable, it is clearly broken down and each milestone is trackable. I would love to see this project split into smaller ones with less budgets and quicker results.

f6_assessments.q0: Problem statement being raising awareness about cardano and also about proposer outreach, their approach of conducting seminars for both blockchain tech and focused seminar for proposer to share ideas effectively addresses the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: They have given details about their plans and time frame for implementation but the experience details mentioned is more generic more details about their previous work would have established more promising deliverability.
f6_assessments.q2: They have provided detailed fund breakdown and also the timeline and number of seminars which can be clear indicators to measure the progress and success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal fit the challenge. They want organize local event that will introduce cardano and catalyst to the attendees. They will also use social media as support. This strategy can be effective for adding new proposers to the catalyst program.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the team stated by the proposer, and the detailed plan, this project can succeed without major issues. According to the proposer, the team has a good of blockchain technology and they are also proposer which may mean that they are familiar with the catalyst program. Based on this informations, they should be able to achieve success with this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The kpi provided in this proposals are precise, which mean that the community can measure the progress of the project. They have also a detailed budget. All in all, this project is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
Yes

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
Yes

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
No team member details, CVs, Linkedin or FB profiles, Youtube channels, or any other info of team members is given

Are these links sufficient?
None given


Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
Nothing to visit


Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
No


Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
No he has not mentioned any team details.

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown? 
The proposal would be more successful if we knew who were team members, who would be host speakers,guest speakers etc. 



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Yes


IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
Yes

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No


Have you verified this plan?
Nothing to verify


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
Yes


Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
Yes



 

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Yes

 


Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
No technical aspects


 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
Only challenge he has considered is Covid related issues. Other than that he has not considered.
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
Yes

 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
Yes. No of meetings each month, No of attendees each month for one day and two day events, and No of new proposers to be involved in Catalyst.


 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
yes. Lack of proposers from Taiwan.

 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes. Offline and Online events.

 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No ( only Covid issues are addressed)


 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
Have the event online if not possible to have online.

 

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
Contingencies are not planned for, other than Covid

f6_assessments.q0:
the efficiency of only Taiwan-oriented outreach is definitely lower than outreach on a global scale. 

Also, the number of sessions/budget/outcome feels very low.
f6_assessments.q1: no information about the proposer was provided, missing some links, previous works.
f6_assessments.q2:
metrics are provided

number of attendees
number of new proposers/new ideas

solution: We aim to build a strong local network to support the growth of the Cardano proposer community in Taiwan.
experience: Our engineering team entered the blockchain space first as miners, then as investors, and now as proposers.
